website_summaries.verdict: Clearly the best choice for gadget enthusiasts. It offers clear reception at a price that isn't out of line for the quality.
pros: Ultra-thin, sleek design and vivid amplifier capabilities
CleanPeak technology that filters out interfering signals for clear channel reception up to a 50-mile range
cons: Though somewhat costly, users can expect high performance for the price

website_summaries.verdict: The Mohu ReLeaf offers decent performance and a flexible, eco-friendly design making it one of the best midrange indoor antennas.
pros: The Mohu ReLeaf is constructed from recycled materials and yet is priced similarly to the nonrecycled original Leaf
The detachable cable offers the user flexibility in placement
cons: ..but the rival Channel Master Flatenna is a third of the price and performs similarly
The gray cardboard construction is a little ugly

customer_reviews.title: Pure Deception
customer_reviews.text: About 99% of the stuff we buy is made in China. So when I see an product with the statement "Premium Materials for Performance, USA Made, MH-110583" I am happy to spend the difference to keep people working here in the United States. The antenna clearly states: Made in China. I cannot find a single item in the package labeled Made In USA. I thought it is Federal law that products not made in the USA have to provide that information on the box. There is no declaration on the box stating where it is made. You can do better Amazon, stuff like this erodes my trust. Will probably return it to get a better price from a local store.
customer_reviews.author: Wish You Were Here

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING. CABLE NO MORE
customer_reviews.text: works great in Chicago, IL. Image quality is beyond amazing (even better than HD quality of cables. Over the Air signals are not compressed so you get the best HD quality you can imagine), Typical channel I get in hte highest HD quality: PBS channels, ABC, NBC, CBS, WGN, Fox Chicago, theU channel and more. Major channels with great quality for FREE! I will attach pics.
customer_reviews.author: Name

customer_reviews.title: **  SO WORTH IT  **
customer_reviews.text: Received it today and hubby set it up in less than 15 minutes and I was on the phone with Direct TV another 15 minutes later. I get seven channels on my kitchen HDTV in NE Atlanta but I've cut the $7 recurring charge for a receiver when I found myself only watching NBC. And, it never worked when it stormed - EVER. I attached a picture and while not everyone's kitchen is mine, the ONLY cord that shows is the white one at which the arrow is pointing. We did not purchase any additional equipment or cord; just the antenna and for us this was definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Duke Boys

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: Some have success with this, but I do not. I get NBC and Fox with this but that is all. I can get NBC without any antenna, so it only improved the picture of NBC and added Fox. I do not get CBS, ABC, PBS or any local stations. The closest CBS is 15 miles away, so it should come in based on the 30 mile range advertised.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Non-working wall decoration
customer_reviews.text: As a TV antenna it is an ugly wall decoration. (reviewing the Leaf 30) Tried multiple locations and orientations but this "antenna" would not pick up the local NBC or PBS or FOX stations at all. The ABC stations were picked up but were troubled by frequent pixalations and freezes. This is on the east side of Portland, OR. All the broadcast towers are less than 15 miles away with a straight line-of-sight, unobstructed view (according to antennaweb.com). We get better reception with an old set of rabbit-ears left over from the analog days. I returned this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to the claimed range and channel reception
customer_reviews.text: I used the range estimator on the Mohu web site before purchase. It indicated I could get 32 channels at my address with this antenna. I was skeptical. Yet figured maybe get half that. But my brand new 4K UHD TV can only find 8 channels with this antenna. No channels with strong enough signal to actually watch. Blocky squares of very bad signal. So not 32 channels. Zero channels. As they say “your mileage may vary”. With this product it appears the mileage claims are not close to what one can actually get.
customer_reviews.author: Sting J

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the # of channels you will get with antenna
customer_reviews.text: I used the Mohu site to see what the best product for my zipcode was....and the Mohu Leaf 30 was supposed to provide us 22 channels for our suburban area. We only get 6. Only one of the 6 is somewhat usable and it cuts out quite frequently. I would really like a product that works and I don't have confidence that buying one for a greater distance will be more functional. This was way lower than our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: JLH09

customer_reviews.title: and I get very clear picture on my LG smart TV. For the price
customer_reviews.text: Works for me. I have it attached to the wall behind my TV, and not near any window, and I get very clear picture on my LG smart TV. For the price, I would highly recommend. I would add a tip, sometimes your TV looses the memory that you stored when you first searched out channels, so that needs to be repeat periodically. I did not know this, and thought that the channels were coming and going, sometimes I could get them and the next day I could not. So through trial and error, I did a new search for channels available, and now it works great. I am very happy with this antenna and free TV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knock-Off Product
customer_reviews.text: It's important to know that Mohu Leaf and Mohu ReLeaf are two very different products. The Mohu Leaf I purchased arrived warped and with a very low-quality, rigid and broken cable. It simply would not screw in to the TV nor the antenna as the small pin in the cable was cut an bent. Using another cable, I tested it and can say that while this product boasts access to a 40-mile radius, it pales in comparison to the performance of a ReLeaf product that claims 30-mile radius. Note that ReLeaf is cheaper than this product. Also note that Amazon requires one star to post a review. This is really a no-star, don't-buy product.
customer_reviews.author: 4Cooks

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, it didn't work
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to get up and running. It scanned for the channels and I could see that it was recognizing many. Unfortunately, the last thing it did was subtract "scrambled" channels. Everything disappeared. I kept receiving a message that there were no channels "memorized". I wanted this to work, and I don't blame the antenna. It's a nice piece of equipment. It's the cable companies. I just read that the FTC gave them permission to scramble the channels. I don't think this is ethical, but that's a whole different discussion. I hope it works for you. This antenna is going back. :(
customer_reviews.author: Twinb1953

customer_reviews.title: Failed to Pick Up More Than 2 Channels
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment in a city where my window faces another building. The antenna failed to pick up more than two channels and even then, it could lose signal if moved. I tried to figure out where on the window it could best pick up channels and the sticky pads they include began to wear out in a few weeks. I bought a Chinese antenna on Amazon that was cheaper and it got me a total of 6 channels, so I deem that one superior to the Leaf.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Arniotes

customer_reviews.title: Comes with black cable, not white as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Beware, this ships with a black cable, it is not white as shown in the photographs. Wish I'd known this because I specifically wanted white to blend into the wall. Functionality-wise, it works well. I had to place it higher up the wall, which means with the black cable is actually a bigger deal looks-wise. I tried hiding it behind the tv at first, but reception was far worse.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I recently hooked this antenna up to my TV and was not sure if it would work well. I have wanted to cancel my cable TV service, which has become too expensive for my budget, for a very long time. I held back because I wasn't sure if this antenna would do the trick. IT DID! My picture quality is better than it was with cable, the sound is perfect and I am getting many more channels than expected. I live in an urban area so I am sure that helps. But I couldn't be happier with the results. Between this antenna and my Amazon TV Fire Stick, I am not missing anything.
customer_reviews.author: FussyOne

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try, if you're giving up cable.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the product for a week and I would recommend it to anyone giving up cable. It works great I know have my local stations without the fuss. If you can get over having to hang the product on the wall and it not being aesthetically pleasing you'll be okay. I was able to pull in about 49 channels, I only feel I truly need 5. Another downside is channels will go fussy, time unknown. So far a good product, I would recommend it to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: RH24

customer_reviews.title: Receives HD channels, but it's "hit or miss"
customer_reviews.text: I should start by saying I've purchased several of these types of antennas and this one doesn't really perform better (or worse) than the previous ones. I can get all my local HD channels, but not all from one antenna position. I have to move the antenna around if I change the channel. This is less than desirable. I have a brick exterior and that probably affects its capability. I'm less than 10 miles away from the city's center and location of most of the TV towers so I feel like I shouldn't have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dad, the Man.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works well, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love this antenna. I have not paid for any kind of cable for more than four years now. Decided to travel instead of wasting money on cable. I bought this for 30 bucks and its literally a heavy plastic sheet hooked to a cable. It has tiny holes near the top corners & literally pins to my wall with thumbtacks. I’ve hidden it behind a tall bookcase & the long cable cord screws right into my hd TV. I get all the local channels plus about 10 others. I know everybody streams now, but this is a really budget conscious way to get some good TV channels while focusing on my goals that are more important than TV.
customer_reviews.author: H Curry

customer_reviews.title: I decided to spend a little more money on a better antenna and had much better luck
customer_reviews.text: For me, this antenna got absolutely NO SIGNAL. I even looked up where the signal was coming from in my area and situated the antenna in a window facing that direction. The stickers that come with the antenna to hang it on a wall worked for maybe 5 minutes before it fell from the wall. I decided to spend a little more money on a better antenna and had much better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Reversible black or white antenna
customer_reviews.text: Was a little disappointed when it arrived with a black coax cable. Spoke with customer service, they apologized but verified they arribitraly put a black or white cable with the antenna depending on what's on hand. Said something about it being a transitional period since ownership of the company had changed. I did double check the Amazon listing. Does not actually list the cable color in words. But, any pictures show a white cable. Beyond that, form and function are very good. Now I'll purchase an off brand at less than half the price and make a comparison regarding function. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design - thin enough to fit inbetween the 'fake' wooden pane lattice and my window. Setup could not be more simple, just connect one end of the supplied cable to my TV and the other to the antenna. I purchased this particular unamplified model because it was the highest rated in a well-know consumer ratings magazine. It did not receive as well as my existing (ampified) rabbit ears. Connecting an antenna amplifier (my own) improved the situation, but still not as good as the existing setup that I was trying to replase. I will be returing this item shortly and have ordered another brand of antenna...
customer_reviews.author: SleepingLion

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work much better than the 5 year old one with which I replaced it....
customer_reviews.text: is just doesn't work that well! skip it! look for an active antenna with actual technical specs like: - minimum signal strength is can recieve in dBmW (make sure this number is LOWER than the weakest terrestrial station in your area) - noise figure (of the antennas that list this number in dB, make sure you have the lowest number) looks like the 90 days return window is over... would really would have liked to return it. yet another thing I'll have to make for myself.
customer_reviews.author: nnm

customer_reviews.title: Good indoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: We received the antenna in excellent condition within the time frame estimate. Easy hook-up to the TV. It still works great in our suburban area, with the HD broadcast antenna on a mountain top around 30 to 40 miles away. Many channels are available. However, the antenna must be positioned in just the right "sweet spot" in your room to pick up the maximum amount of stations clearly, without tiling/pixeling. Some YouTube videos and other internet info sites explain how to get the most out of this antenna, like placing it near a window or other place with the least obstructions to the broadcast signal.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Paspal

customer_reviews.title: One of best indoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: **Update** Mohu just sent me additional white cable. For their kind customer service, I've updated my review to 5 star. This antenna is bit pricy but it is definitely one of best indoor antenna with good reception. My only issue is that included coaxial cable was not the white color as advertised on Amazon. I received the black coaxial cable and it doesn't match the wall color.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it more stars I would. This is the 2nd Mohu Leaf we have purchased. This one if for the bedroom. Small price to pay for the local stations and the best is, no monthly charges. We originally purchased the first one so we could get the local morning and evening news shows, but found many more interesting programs. Lots of old series shows we'd forgotten about, some new nature stuff and we can get all the network channels as well. Clear picture and sound. No interruptions. We have recommended this to all of our friends. We were able to get rid of our ridiculously expensive Directv Dish bill. Very easy to install and set up.
customer_reviews.author: SJR

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: My house is 20 miles from the towers in Phoenix. My TV is not by a window, so the antenna had to go behind the TV. Different spots pull in different channels. Since I only care about having ABC, CBS and NBC, I chose a spot behind my entertainment center - also behind a piece of art. I don't get FOX, but don't need it either. I'm sure I could adjust it more and get all 4. This is perfect for what I wanted. Matched it up with a TiVo Roamio OTA, which has no subscription fee - perfect way to cut the cord for good.
customer_reviews.author: Keilla

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: I have a flat antenna (Winegard, maybe?), but it has an attached cord that is not long enough. I have used a male-male adapter to add a short length of coax cable. I saw the Mohu has no attached cable, so bought it along with an appropriate length of coax. The Mohu was smaller and probably because of this, I got 1/3 less channels. Neither is amped (last amped one was worse), and both were used in same window spot, so is an accurate comparison. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: JD Larrick

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It's fine. The reviews I read say this is the best out there, so if this is the best then so be it. Picks up about 20 channels on tuning, but actually recieves only about 10 that can be watched and even then suffers regular break up - this is less good than I expected given that we are only a few miles from the transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Pink

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to cancel my over priced cable TV since I just watch mostly basic local channels and either stream or Netflix. This product turned out very good. I've had these antennas for a while now and just getting around to writing a review since I like to use a product first for some time to make sure it withstands use, etc. It sure has.. I think it's been at least two years now and all is good. Just position them at an angle where reception is good and you're good to go. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are better ones for sure
customer_reviews.text: If you are within 20 miles of a tower you're OK. You will also likely need a amp/booster either way. I am 30 miles from towers & get no signals without a booster.
customer_reviews.author: DWD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this antenna based on reviews - but was disappointed. My primary TV station transmitters are just under 20 miles from my house (according to tvfool.com) with no hills or large buildings between. The antenna was mounted 20' above ground level, yet I could not receive the three primary TV stations in my area. I did receive 17 stations; when I went to an attic-mounted antenna, I picked up 49 - including the three primary local stations crystal-clear.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The internet was right for once: this antenna does rock AND is affordable
customer_reviews.text: According to numerous comparisons and shootouts of HD antenna's this is antenna is consistently top 3 for unpowered interior mounted antennas, with the  coming in top 3 for powered or "amplified". So how did they stack up for me living 30 miles northeast of Seattle? 30 channels for Mohu, 32 for the amplified RCA (26 unplugged). Mohu, however, had a much superior image quality on my 65" HD TV. Both received a handful of channels from Vancouver, Canada, which is at least 150 rough terrain miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy P.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Set it up in 2 minutes ... picked up 44 channels instantly ... I set mine up against the wall (opposite from the towers), just above the TV. Held it up by two pins ... Also, as recommended by others on the reviews, I took the two twist ties that keep the co-ax cable secured and put each one through a hole (next to the pin holding the antenna up). I made a couple of twists and formed make-shift rabbit ears. Not sure if it made a difference, but I am happy with this product's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Florencio Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous antenna!
customer_reviews.text: This little antenna works like a charm. I really like how thin and small it is. I hung it up behind my tv on the wall so it is hidden. I purchased it when my Satellite provider decided not to carry a couple of my local channels. I can now tune into several local channels for free with this antenna! As soon as my contract is up with my Satellite provider I will be dropping them and using this little antenna along with my Netflix. No more of my local channels being held hostage by Satellite companies for extremely high prices!
customer_reviews.author: BGrant

customer_reviews.title: Exasperating and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Exasperating and a waste of money......very cheap wiring inside.....glad to toss it out after all the lost channels
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Saves us 50$/month every month
customer_reviews.text: We've been a cord cutter since 2010. Just needed something to cover the local news and some sports. Mohu leaf solved the problem for less than any other options. (This was several years ago, still going strong). We don't get all the FTA channels because we live in the hills...and probably some other options would've worked better but for our use - this is fine. Last year we moved our TV and I had to buy a 25 feet cable to keep it near mohu leaf a window. Still works.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: The Floor
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm so long as we leave it on the floor. I dropped it by accident when we were checking different places on the wall and window. The best reception to be found for all of our channels was literally on the floor. Go figure! lol
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Here in greater Boston, with the antenna facing south towards all the TV towers, it probably picks up a dozen channels, of which maybe 1 or 2 are worth watching. In other words, if you watch a lot of network TV, this thing is pretty hopeless. You can watch old (very dark picture) episodes of Frasier late at night, and most of the PBS stations. Not much else.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This product was wonderfully easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This product was wonderfully easy to set up. I don't know anything about TVs. But the instructions were simple, and my son helped me set it up. It was pretty much plug and play. The picture quality is amazing. I only get a dozen channels with it (maybe because my TV is in the basement), but it is a dozen more than I was previously getting. I'm really happy about this purchase because, well, you don't know what you're going to get when you order online. The setup was easy ... real easy ... and the product does what it says it will do. Can't beat that. Free TV!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor P. Huggins

customer_reviews.title: More expensive doesn't always mean it's better
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to upgrade my current antenna which i paid around 12 bucks for. After doing some research I decided to go with this one thinking I'd get more channels. That was not the case. I put the antenna in the same spot as my old one. I got the same exact channels with the only difference being 2 (Fox) and 4 (NBC) that I normally had a hard time recieving with my old antenna. In short, you're better off buying the cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: kevin k.

customer_reviews.title: "I'm Melting!"
customer_reviews.text: AntennaWeb dot org says I'm approx. 13 miles from the 10 main broadcast channels in my area. This antenna works well. I have it hooked up to a HDHomeRun Connect for my Plex setup. It works, and I've successfully recorded channels simultaneously on the antenna. Now for the bad part, it is literally melting. It's warped, and bending itself into a non-rectangular shape. It's not been a sauna here. We're not in Arizona. It began it's demise when the temperature was no more than 50F. So, that's disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye $100 cable bill
customer_reviews.text: This gives us a lot of old shows but keeps money in the bank. Very easy to put together and the picture quality is great...as long as it isn't storming where the signals come from. But then with cable we'd lose the signal at least two days a month. Love that we get local news.
customer_reviews.author: Deb in Everett

customer_reviews.title: No reception on windy day
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's the trees or being inside the city but when the wind is blowing my reception goes in and out. I hardly ever watch the TV which is hooked to this antenna because it just doesn't work unless it's a perfectly still no wind at all day. Again it could be that I have trees over my house and the wind swayze the trees.However it's still the same results even in the winter when there are no leaves. I really don't know but it just doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: carrie

customer_reviews.title: It barely worked
customer_reviews.text: Despite the fact that the FCC DTV coverage shown for my street location is rated as "strong" for all but four of the broadcast stations, I could only get two major networks (CBS and NBC), and the picture dropped out of the CBS station after dusk and wouldn't return until morning. NBC was available about 80% of the time, and was the only network station I watch that was usually available. I got no PBS stations at all. I tried every location within the 10-foot range of the included cable. If one station improved, another dropped out. When it was "locked on" to a station, quality was great--until it wavered and dropped out.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence S.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Special
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this hoping the larger unit would pick up more than our 11 channels on our tiny flat unit. It only picked up 8 channels and the digital quality was digitized pixels on some channels that usually come in very clear. They were kind to refund us for our return.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: The installation instructions were easy enough to follow, and there are plenty of YT videos on the topic. I get pretty good signal with this antenna here in suburbia. I have two of these, one upstairs and one downstairs, they both work as expected. I get 25-30 channels, although two channels (5 and 17) seem to cut out from time to time, and I don't know why. I would recommend this for anyone as long as they aren't too far out of town.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Herron

customer_reviews.title: Highest-rated antenna for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment on the longevity of this, but I expect it to give me many years of fault-free use. I hooked this up (super easily) expecting to get the 19 local channels that the product's website said I'd get, but what I actually got was 41! I am very pleased with this antenna. My old antenna would cut out whenever a car drove by, whenever the sun was at the right angle, when it was cloudy, when my dog farted... this one just. plain. works.
customer_reviews.author: James Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would get a new "digital" antenna to go with the ota dvr I just purchased. I should have known better. What stations(10) that did come in were very pixelated no matter how I placed it. I rummaged thru the junk closet and pulled out an old predigital rabbit ear antenna and got over 30 the channels and only 2 pixelate sometimes. So it may look better than rabbit ears, but does not work near as well. Not worth money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark615

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried unsuccessfully for over a month to get this antenna to deliver me a handful of local channels whose towers are all within 20 miles. Keep moving it on an outside wall and the only time it worked was when my daughter-in-law held it up in her hand. Now, it just is not possible to have her stand in my house and hold an antenna when I want to watch TV!!! Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several antennas and have not found any that get more than six clear channels. My house is near the base of a ridge and many signals can't reach. I get PBS (10-1, 10-2, 10-3, 10-4), 12-1 and 49-1 crystal clear. The Mohu leaf was easy to install and the picture is way better than any other antennas I've tried. I like it. The only other way to get more channels is to install a very expensive outdoor (tall) mast antenna system, with a 360 degree rotation motor.
customer_reviews.author: JimiB

customer_reviews.title: Better than the cheaper ones
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a couple of very cheap leaf receivers that had amplifier boosters and they worked fine. One of the cheaper ones started to act up really bad so I bought this Mohu. The Mohu didn't work very well until I decided to plug it into the digital amplifier booster and has worked really well since. So the quality of the Mohu is way better but it does need to be connected to a amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: LAW

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Worked out so well on one tv we bought two more. The range is good and the reception as well. Of course, you have to fiddle around with the position you use, as a few feet up, down or sideways make a big difference. We used this to replace an RCA antenna which supposedly had a power boost and this one is much better. We picked it after seeing a review in Consumer Reports that ranked it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Heilman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna doesn’t work very well at all! Do not waste your money. I’ve tried different televisions in my apt, and different locations just to know if it was my building, it’s garbage!
customer_reviews.author: jason swaney

customer_reviews.title: This does work, although not as effective as a roof antenna
customer_reviews.text: Most local channels come in pretty reliably. Occasional pixelation. I bought an "Amazon Warehouse" used one for $10. Can't go wrong for $10! Consumer Reports rates these highest over much-more-expensive competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic Reader

customer_reviews.title: I'm not saying the product is bad, but although free tv looks good on paper
customer_reviews.text: Gave me 6 channels, and I live 10 miles from the source. Tried multiple angles, and all I got was a few channels which btw are not needed in any way. Mostly just Telemarketing ads, or a bunch of people talking, a channel showing B&W ads, another showing movies from the 80s, not even proper news. Unfortunately I didn't return it in time so I'm stuck with it. I'm not saying the product is bad, but although free tv looks good on paper, there's not enough good content to invest in anything like this. If you get netflix, that might help more with getting better content and also cordcutting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, white cords are a plus in my decor
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Mohu Leaf antenna that I had for about 5 years. It's reception started deteriorating in the last year. After tinkering with it, I decided to replace it. I first tried some other antenna options, but none had white cords like the Leaf, which disappear more readily in my decor. So I ordered this one and have been very happy with it. It receives about the same number of channels, and reception is good even on fairly windy days. I guess they don't last forever, but they are reasonable enough if the life span is only 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Book Fiend

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. I bought this particular Mohu Antenna to replace ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I bought this particular Mohu Antenna to replace an older one (couple of years) that I had, thinking that I would gain even more channels. Sadly, I have actually digressed rather than increased (went from 33 to 20 even in good weather conditions). My prior antenna was affixed to a high point with Command strips that I re-utilized for this newer design. However, this particular one is larger and has no weight behind it so it actually folds over. I've already found scratches on it.
customer_reviews.author: Monti

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Reception and Quality
customer_reviews.text: For $30 this antenna takes 3 minutes to unpackage, install a coax cable, and attach to your TV or tuner. Tuner found 60+ channels in a 3 min scan and we get crystal clear picture on all of them in a dense urban area. Only con is the included coax cable was coated in white powdery residue that resulted in us using a different, clean cable we had on hand. We really like that we can hang/store the antenna out of sight behind the tv when not watching, and pop it up when we are. Thin, flexible design allows us to minimize the eyesore of an antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Schleitwiler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as well as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: All the main stations where I live are only 25 miles away max. I went online and checked who was available before I purchased this item. It's mounted on an upper area of my wall and has large windows directly across. I'm supposed to be able to receive everyone - 3, 10, and 13. I can only get 3 (which comes in very clear) but 10 is very pixelated and not watchable and I can't even find 13 on the guide. I'm quite disappointed and not sure why this is occurring. I'm considering returning.
customer_reviews.author: bluepony

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown
customer_reviews.text: Picture shows a WHITE cable. Mine came with a Black cable - not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: vnuzz

customer_reviews.title: Really worth the value!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a metro area so I'm within 10 miles of a TV tower. When I received the antenna, I placed it on the wall closest to the tv. I ran the channel scanner and got only 7 channels. But....I then moved it 5 feet and scanned again and got 65 channels. Some were duplicates since they were HD and SD. I deleted those and a few others. I still have 45 channels. Only disappointed I can't get either of our PBS channels. But reception is crystal clear. Antenna is just resting in the bottom of the window.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon S

customer_reviews.title: Picks up lots of channels
customer_reviews.text: Picks up all local channels in HD plus other antenna channels that I never knew about, including classic movies, old sitcoms, etc for when you are looking for something different. My RCA antenna loses signal if not "just right". The Mohu has never needed adjustment. And I love that it is reversible and flat. By flat I mean thin, like an envelope or a cereal box. But not easy to rip because it is durable plastic. I hardly notice it on the wall because it blends in. Plus the included connection cable is plenty long. I use the antenna with a Samsung Smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: DoberMom

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern was the ease of getting a clear picture. When I could fine tune the Mohu leaf it was a good picture. Shortly after purchase I went back to the Rabbit ears & for me they worked best. I ignored the FAA recommendation & tryied to save money, which could possible give me more than 9 channels. My location is California, 92025-facing West 3rd floor
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Performed Admirably but Not Suitable for a Basement (try the powered version)
customer_reviews.text: This unit performed very well considering the environment I put it in. I installed this on the TV in my basement media room so that I could pick up better video quality (than cable) for football games. While this antenna was able to pick up most channels it was unable to do so for a critical channel Network channel. All in all, if I would have needed this antenna for another floor in my house it would have been an excellent choice. I will look into Mohu's power assisted antenna for my basement.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of time and money. I've tried several of Mohu's products on multiple TV's in a major metropolitan center, none have worked, even their highest end ones. Their customer service is awful, don't ever expect a response. I submitted a return request and sent them four emails and haven't so much as received a response in over two weeks. It's like they won't even let me return their garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I spent a good two hours trying multiple locations and only one or ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how this is listed as having a 40 mile radius because when I checked what stations were available to me, there were dozens that were within 20-30 miles and NONE of them came in. Now maybe if I was not a single woman who doesn't have time to climb onto the roof to try a million different positions for this, I would have gotten it to work, but as it stood, I spent a good two hours trying multiple locations and only one or two spanish stations came in. I am giving it more than one star simply because it's cute.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ardito

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Got this after we ditched cable for free programming this past year. Hung it behind our TV so it was hidden. Hit the button to program the TV and a few minutes later is had 12 channels clear as cable ever was. Will it magically suck 100 4k digital channels out of the air? Nope. But it will pick up whatever channels they broadcast in your area, and it will bring them in strong and clear. I'd buy it again for sure. I live in a smaller town in a mountainous region in Montana. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'll get a few channels you like, to be sure
customer_reviews.text: Got 15 channels in the BASEMENT completely underground, almost half of which I would watch/can understand. Your experience may be different. I would check your LOCAL listings to see what you might be able to access. The website has you enter a zip code and shows you the channels you will likely get. My son gets more channels in his above-ground apartment. The website said I would get 16. SO so so super easy to install and for a young man just starting out, this price paid ONE TIME is way more affordable than $100 a MONTH for cable or dish. He gets all the network stations, so he gets the local sports teams and he is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Works just about as good as cheaper types I've used - maybe that my house exterior is stucco that typically uses a metal mesh backing that could theoretically interfere with the signal.. Broadcast channels in my area are line-of-sight but transmitted from two main antennas about 60-degrees apart one direction is received stronger than the other. Product seems to work best in my house placed mid-height on the wall near the corner.
customer_reviews.author: FrugalShopper

customer_reviews.title: Just about the simplest imaginable
customer_reviews.text: Took about five minutes to set up, and that's because I insisted on reading the directions. It works perfectly, with an incredible picture, and gets around 60 channels. If it weren't for the NFL, baseball, and the Pac-12, I might just cancel DISH. Interestingly, the sound is louder with the antenna than with DISH. No idea why. I was skeptical that this would work. Now I'm a believer.
customer_reviews.author: orloffsahoy

customer_reviews.title: Much better performance than my old RCA flat antenna
customer_reviews.text: I heard about this brand on YouTube and bought one of the cheaper ones they offer. Not disappointed. I receive at least 5 more channels than before and the reception is much more reliable than before. I also like the fact that it has a white and dark side with small holes for tacking directly to a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Right direction makes it easy.
customer_reviews.text: The Mohu leaf does a great job if you can place it in the direction of the broadcast towers. I bought 2 of them for other rooms . In room 1 it works great but room 2 would not pick up 3 local stations because I was unable to place it in the right direction. I have returned one & purchased an amplified OTA. It works like a charm. Mohu makes really good products.
customer_reviews.author: Gram 26

customer_reviews.title: Slightly worse than cheap rabbit ears.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this antenna because the manufacturer has/had a good reputation. I was hoping to improve reception on a few of the weaker channels in my area. I was sorely disappointed. This was worse than my $5 rabbit ear antenna. I actually LOST reception of my local ABC affiliate whereas the cheapo rabbit ears picked it up fine. I’m sure this may work well for some people, but the price is not at all justified by the performance for me. Ultimately I returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: Ditching cable TV by moving to country, leaving Dish/DirecTV for streaming through Amazon Fire TV, these do pretty darned good for catching local programming - but where we live ABC channel 10 (KAKE FOR KANSASANS) we just can’t get. Luckily there’s an app for that!
customer_reviews.author: EXCLUSIVE SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble receiving a signal for many broadcast channels in one room of the house, so I thought I would give this a try. I had used a couple of different antennas before this one with little siccess. Fortunately, this comes with a long cable so I was able to get this to an outside wall where it perfomed much better than others.I would recomment this. Consider that you have the option of placing it in a location away from the television that is a better spot for the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Paschall

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a QUALITY product
customer_reviews.text: I Live right in a larger city that does not require any amplified signals. This antenna is refurbished. Came in a sealed plain box from Mohu marked "open". Included directions and coiled cable. This antenna is probably the best antenna I have tried in the past couple years. It was purchased for an extra TV upstairs but does outperform my other flat hard case RCA for the same price. Highly recommended even in refurb condition. Easy to move or hang on door to pull in a couple stations that require twisting the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Chihuahua

customer_reviews.title: These Do Work
customer_reviews.text: Our dad didnt want to pay a monthly cable payment. We tried this by carrying it in many places in his living room. We installed it near the ceiling on the wall above a window because it supplied the best picture of anywhere in the room. We then scanned for channels and were able to reach 17 (!) Mostly PBS and local stations. One is from a about 50 miles from his home with local news, weather and programming. Dad is pleased since he can watch some programs he enjoys and gets the news and weather all for FREE!
customer_reviews.author: NanaS

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cable Cutters!
customer_reviews.text: Clear picture. We live about 15-20 miles from local stations and close to international airport & pulls in between 40-50 channels. Channels get a little fuzzy sometimes when bad storms move in or planes fly over but not too bad. Do have patience. It’s not cable or DVR so channels can take a minute to come in and commercials are ‘a-plenty”! :)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.DP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Local!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I have Sling TV instead of cable/satellite but was in need of local channels (NFL IS BACK!). This is insanely easy to install - took about 25 seconds and it was done. I was watching an NFL game a minute later. If looking for local channels you cannot go wrong with this. PS: I paired mine with an XBOX One and Hauppauge Digital TV Tuner and it works like a charm.Check your area first to see how far away your tower is - the 30 mile radius this has was more than enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Received defective item. Earlier product was A+
customer_reviews.text: Turned out to be defective. How do I know? Because the other Mohu antenna got all the channel I watch while this one didn’t. Now I need to go through the hassle of returning. Also, new cable is black. Really? So you can see it snaking down your wall?
customer_reviews.author: RoyTech

customer_reviews.title: what a fantastic picture
customer_reviews.text: so many compliments from folks visiting asking if the tv is on cable or fiber, what a surprise when they find out it's free tv, those daytime soap operas look like they are being filmed in the living room, it's not even a 3d tv and yet the quality from the $100 tv is beyond compare, so easy to install, connect and scan for stations
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: With it
customer_reviews.text: If it costs a little more it's worth it... perfect picture quality. I picked up 4& channels FOR FREE
customer_reviews.author: MoTown

customer_reviews.title: Good product and even better after a 25% discount. :-)
customer_reviews.text: We live approximately 16-18 nautical miles from broadcast centers in Atlanta, GA which are to the NW of us. The antenna is being used in an upstairs bedroom on the SE corner of the house. After moving it in front of a window facing South, we were still able to pick up 33 channels. The picture quality and reception are both excellent.
customer_reviews.author: C Sean

customer_reviews.title: See you later cable!
customer_reviews.text: $212 a month for internet and two cable boxes. No thanks! Takes about 2 minutes to install, the push pins and the velcro mounts are a great idea. I ended up mounting the antenna on the window. 63 channels upstairs and 38 channels downstairs(I bought two). I get the major network channels along with PBS and a bunch of others. The signal strength is fine and the picture is cleaner than cable. Saving $150 a month will be much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: B M

customer_reviews.title: Out Performs Others at This Price Point
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this antenna for years and I have nothing bad to say about it. As with any OTA indoor antenna you will have to move it about from time to time to pick up certain channels cleanly but that is to be expected. I have tried other antennas at this price point and I think the Leaf out performs them. Remember that you will get different results in different areas and everything depends on what OTA channels are available in your area. You may have a bit more trouble picking up channel in mountainous territories. All in all a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on unreliable and inconsistent antenna.  Totally aggravating!
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this antenna. But unfortunately, does not always work. Only got 3 NBC, 3 CBS, and a few others. Maybe 8 or 9 channels in all. No ABC at all. When it works, the picture quality was great. I am only 17-20 miles from major stations. But, as I said, very unreliable. Don't waste your money. As you can see from the pictures, no working!
customer_reviews.author: Maine Connection

customer_reviews.title: V. good TV antenna
customer_reviews.text: Compact and simple to install, good signal reception covers all major digital and non-digital stations in the Washington Metro area without using the amplifier that comes with some models.
customer_reviews.author: SFR

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was genuinely surprised by how well the device works. With my prior antenna I was getting decent picture quality and sound, but there were multiple dropouts and it was frequently necessary to reposition the antenna. With this device, I plugged it in, hung it on a wall, and I got all the local channels with no need to do anything!
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We can almost see the TV towers (darn trees), so I wasn't surprised that this work, but it works great. At first I put this on the wall behind (not directly) the TV, and most stations came in. A couple didn't so we moved to the window, which was 90 degrees from the earlier orientation. The stations that didn't come in before now came in but we lost a few that came in earlier. So I split the difference and put in the corner, and it worked great. It faced the corner (thus some wood and stucco), but the picture was amazing. Since I used a HDHomeRun, I could share the signal with TVs all over the house (recommended).
customer_reviews.author: Shane O. Laake

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: I found this antenna unsatisfactory. It certainly is stylish and unobtrusive but its ability to draw in all major local channels is limited. I live in the suburbs less than 20 miles from NYC and am situated at a higher altitude than my surroundings with no obstructions. Yet, I can get only five of the seven commercial channels. My PBS channel is most important to me and I can’t get it. I’ve tried it on all my TV’s at various orientations with no success. I plan to try a different antenna – one with an RF amplifier. Hope that helps. If not, I suppose I’ll need to resort to a good roof antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Prof W

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We cut the cord with cable and this antennae works great. I purchased two (one for each television) and it was very easy to install. I had to move it around a bit to get all the channels however that was very easy. The picture is great, however with an antennae if there is a severe storm the reception gets a bit dicey. For a one time fee and not having to pay for cable any more this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna just didn't get all the parts.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Hooked it up in just a few minutes did a scan and got 42 stations. Moved it just about 12" left in the window and ran another scan. Picked up 60 stations. Dinging it a start because the mounting pins and velcro pads weren't included in the box. I just used a couple of small suction cups with built in hooks that I had on hand anyway. They worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Corum

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I purchased this. Picked up the needed channels I was missing using a standard rabbit ear antenna. Placed it near my window to get the extra channels and the picture clarity is very good. Definitely worth the money. You just have to figure out where to place it for best results in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! We had purchased a less expensive antenna and got a few channels but saw a review on this product on a website called Disable My Cable [...] You can type in your zip code and see what channels you can get in your area. We purchased this antenna and hooked it up immediately. Viola we have all the stations we wanted especially NBC which didn't come in with the less expensive antenna. Now we can watch the Olympics and NFL Football. So worth the money! We are now buying a second one for our other TV!
customer_reviews.author: SMR

customer_reviews.title: Great picture if placed correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Many factors affect these flat antennas, especially location and position (facing north-south vs. East-west). The higher it’s placed and closer to a window the better signal you’ll get. When getting a good signal the picture is startlingly clear, way better than cable or satellite.
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: WORKS IS AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This HD Antenna is wonderful, it is super easy to install, is paper thin and hangs on the wall practically undetected. I placed it near a window and it worked within seconds. I live in the center of Miami Beach, on the first floor of a highrise with many highrise condos and hotels around me and was afraid it would interfere with reception however I am getting about 80 channels with all the major channels in HD. I love it and would highly recommend it to anyone who's looking to cut the cord on cable.
customer_reviews.author: Miss M

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Robust
customer_reviews.text: Bye, bye cable TV! This antenna was the solution to get digital over-the-air local programs into the flat screen. Everything is pretty much plastic which is not an issue. Place the antenna next to the TV on a flat spot on the TV stand and it enabled the TV to scan for all the local channels I expected (plus a few more) in the Chicagoland area. No regrets and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: NoYouCan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the more expensive one I bought a few years ago. Turns out I didn't need that one. This is the one. and cheaper. Yeah! I live in downtown city area amongst high rises and was having trouble, thought my picture quality was because of that even though stations were not that far away, but after some online research decided to give this Antenna a try and it is the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: LauraB

customer_reviews.title: Won't pick up all local channels
customer_reviews.text: I live in northwest Las Vegas and most of the TV antennae are located on Black Mtn Henderson about 28 miles straight-line distant from our house, there are no intervening geographical features (I can see Black Mtn clearly with binocs). Nonetheless, the CBS station KLAS has spotty reception; all other local stations are fine. For comparison: KLAS (8), 30.1kw, KSNV (3) 27.7kw; KVVU (5), 86kw; KLVX (10), 105kw; and KTNV (13), 30.5kw. I can't use the Leaf 30 antenna unless it receives ALL local channels clearly. Btw don't ask me if I moved it around. Of course I did! I wanted to get off cable. I tried everything I knew how--except putting it outside.
customer_reviews.author: DanC

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy to get the antenna channels which I personally use for background tv - news or DIY shows or old movies - things I am not really sitting down to watch. Once in a while there's a show I actually want to watch and I'm glad to have access with no further payment beyond the cost of this antenna!
customer_reviews.author: MommySan

customer_reviews.title: Installation could not be any easier.
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most is, it was bonehead simple to install, and it just works. YMMV, as OTA reception is very much location dependent, but having just installed a Leaf at my daughter’s apartment in Albuquerque, I was very pleasantly surprised that straight away, it pulled in well over 70 local channels, including all of the majors. And that was without having to play around with orientation; we literally just tacked it to the wall directly behind the TV. Pro reviews were pretty favorable, but with OTA reception, you don’t know until you try. The Leaf 30 in our location hit it right out of the park.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: I got something like 27 channels
customer_reviews.text: I lived in the DC area, I got something like 27 channels. When I moved away to a more remote area I got none. Gave one to a friend in Baltimore she also got a bunch of channels. Always check "TVfool" online before you buy this kind of antenna to see if you'll actually get any reception
customer_reviews.author: VV

product_meta.title: Mohu Leaf 30 Television Antenna, Indoor, 30 Mile Range, Original Paper-thin, Reversible, Paintable, 4K-Ready HDTV, 10 Foot Detachable Cable, Premium Materials for Performance, USA Made, MH-110598
product_meta.description:
The Original Paper Thin Indoor HDTV Antenna 

Mohu Leaf 30 is the award-winning antenna that jumpstarted the cord cutting revolution. Launched in 2011, Leaf 30 established the trend of paper-thin antennas with many others striving to achieve the same quality and design. Leaf 30 was the first and continues to be one of the top-rated and most popular HDTV antennas available on the market.

Antenna Made in USA – Derived from US Military Technology The patented Leaf 30 was modeled after life-saving technology designed and developed for the US Military to discreetly detect IEDs, making it the most reliable and sophisticated indoor antenna on the market today. We are proud of our military connection, and it is evident in our design, quality, and stability. We are also proud to say that our Leaf antennas are made in USA.

Watch 100% Free TV in HD Leaf 30 lets you enjoy over-the-air networks in your area without paying a monthly fee. That means you can watch 94 of the 100 most-watched TV shows for free from networks like ABC, CBS, FOX, NBC, PBS, The CW, Univision and more. And because over-the-air broadcasts are uncompressed, you will experience the clearest picture quality possible with your HDTV antenna.

Highest Quality, Sleek Design, Easy Installation Mohu Leaf 30 is now tested to reach up to a 40-mile radius and includes a high performance 10 ft. detachable coaxial cable, giving users the flexibility to place the antenna much higher on a wall or close to a window for optimal reception. Leaf 30 indoor HDTV antenna is also paintable and reversible to match decor, and much easier on the eyes than a traditional antenna. Setup is as easy as plugging it in, turning on your TV, and scanning for channels.
feature_bullets: ABSOLUTELY FREE HD TV FOR LIFE: 40 mile range HDTV Digital Antenna to access High Definition, Over-the-Air TV channels without a cable or satellite subscription including ABC CBS NBC PBS Fox Univision and more
THE ORIGINAL PAPER-THIN INDOOR HDTV ANTENNA: Derived from advanced US military antennas technology and engineered to provide superior access to more free HDTV channels in 1080 HD
10 FT LONG COAXIAL CABLE INCLUDED: Multi-directional and reversible digital antenna, paintable to match any decor "no pointing" needed

RECEPTION TOTALLY DEPENDENT ON LOCATION and the type of signal being transmitted in the area (VHF/UHF). DISCLAIMER: The results of available channels in your area is an estimate based on your location and the location of the TV transmitters in your area and is not guaranteed. Every location is unique in terms of local terrain foliage and installation details which will affect your reception.

SATISFACTION GUARANTEED: Our customer service team of industry professionals is here to provide you with all the support you need! We are confident in the quality of our product and offer a 1-year warranty AND fantastic customer service. Email us at support@gomohu.com or call 1-855-4GOMOHU (855-446-6648) for support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,394 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
